    88â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ CONTENT.md

    91â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ CODEBASE.md                   # This file - architecture docs
    92â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ DESIGN.md                     # Design system documentation
    93â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ DEVLOG.md                     # Developer log (session history)
    94â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ROADMAP.md                    # Project roadmap
    95â†’â””â”€â”€ vitest.config.ts                  # Test configuration
    96â†’```
    97â†’
    98â†’### Key Patterns
    99â†’
   100â†’1. **Inline Styles with CSS Variables**: Components use inline `style` props with CSS variables
   101â†’   ```tsx
   102â†’   style={{ color: 'var(--color-text-primary)' }}
   103â†’   ```
   104â†’
   105â†’2. **Theme via data-attribute**: Theme switching uses `data-theme` on `<html>`
   106â†’   ```css
   107â†’   [data-theme="light"] { --color-background: #fafafa; }
   108â†’   ```
   109â†’
   110â†’3. **ThemeContext**: Provides `isDark`, `toggleTheme`, `theme` - but NOT colors (deprecated)
   111â†’
   112â†’4. **Universal CV - Variant System**: Portfolio personalization for job applications
   113â†’   - Base profile + variant overrides = personalized experience
   114â†’   - Dynamic routes via HashRouter (`/#/:company/:role`)
   115â†’   - VariantContext provides merged profile to components
   116â†’   - Sections receive `profile` prop from context (not direct imports)
   117â†’
   118â†’---
   119â†’
   120â†’## Universal CV System
   121â†’
   122â†’### Overview
   123â†’
   124â†’The Universal CV system creates personalized portfolio variants tailored to specific job applications using AI-generated overrides of the base profile.
   125â†’
   126â†’**Live Examples:**
   127â†’- Base: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/`
   128â†’- Bloomberg TPM: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/bloomberg/technical-product-manager`
   129â†’- Gensyn TPM: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/gensyn/technical-product-manager`
   130â†’
   131â†’### Architecture
   132â†’
   133â†’**Data Flow:**
   134â†’```
   135â†’URL (/#/company/role)
   136â†’  â†’ React Router captures params
   137â†’  â†’ VariantPortfolio.tsx loads variant JSON
   138â†’  â†’ variants.ts: mergeProfile(base + overrides)
   139â†’  â†’ VariantContext provides merged profile
   140â†’  â†’ Portfolio.tsx receives from context
   141â†’  â†’ Sections (Hero, About, etc.) receive profile prop
   142â†’  â†’ Personalized content rendered
   143â†’```
   144â†’
   145â†’**Key Files:**
   146â†’- `src/context/VariantContext.tsx` - Profile injection system
   147â†’- `src/pages/VariantPortfolio.tsx` - Dynamic variant loader
   148â†’- `src/lib/variants.ts` - Loading + merging logic
   149â†’- `src/types/variant.ts` - Type definitions
   150â†’- `scripts/generate-cv.ts` - CLI generator (243 lines)
   151â†’- `content/variants/*.{yaml,json}` - Variant data
   152â†’
   153â†’### Variant Schema
   154â†’
   155â†’```typescript
   156â†’interface Variant {
   157â†’  metadata: {
   158â†’    company: string;
   159â†’    role: string;
   160â†’    slug: string;
   161â†’    generatedAt: string;
   162â†’    jobDescription: string;
   163â†’    generationModel?: string;
   164â†’  };
   165â†’  overrides: {
   166â†’    hero?: {
   167â†’      status?: string;
   168â†’      headline?: HeadlineSegment[];
   169â†’      subheadline?: string;
   170â†’    };
   171â†’    about?: {
   172â†’      tagline?: string;
   173â†’      bio?: string[];
   174â†’      stats?: Stat[];
   175â†’    };
   176â†’    sections?: {
   177â†’      beyondWork?: boolean;
   178â†’      blog?: boolean;
   179â†’      onchainIdentity?: boolean;
   180â†’      skills?: boolean;
   181â†’      passionProjects?: boolean;
   182â†’    };
   183â†’  };
   184â†’  relevance?: {
   185â†’    caseStudies?: Array<{ slug: string; relevanceScore: number; reasoning?: string }>;
   186â†’    skills?: Array<{ category: string; relevanceScore: number }>;
   187â†’    projects?: Array<{ slug: string; relevanceScore: number; reasoning?: string }>;
   188â†’  };
   189â†’}
   190â†’```
   191â†’
   192â†’### Creating Variants
   193â†’
   194â†’**CLI Generator:**
   195â†’```bash
   196â†’npm run generate:cv -- \
   197â†’  --company "Company" \
   198â†’  --role "Role Title" \
   199â†’  --jd "./job-description.txt" \
   200â†’  --provider gemini
   201â†’```
   202â†’
   203â†’**Supported Providers:**
   204â†’- Claude (Anthropic): `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`
   205â†’- OpenAI: `OPENAI_API_KEY`
   206â†’- Gemini (Google): `GEMINI_API_KEY`
   207â†’
   208â†’### Component Integration
   209â†’
   210â†’**IMPORTANT**: Sections that show personalized content MUST receive `profile` as a prop:
   211â†’
   212â†’```tsx
   213â†’// âœ… CORRECT - Receives profile from context
   214â†’function HeroSection({ profile, isMobile }: { profile: Profile; isMobile: boolean }) {
   215â†’  const { hero } = profile;  // Uses variant profile
   216â†’  // ...
   217â†’}
   218â†’
   219â†’// âŒ INCORRECT - Direct import bypasses variants
   220â†’import { profile } from '../lib/content';
   221â†’function HeroSection({ isMobile }: { isMobile: boolean }) {
   222â†’  const { hero } = profile;  // Always uses base profile!
   223â†’  // ...
   224â†’}
   225â†’```
   226â†’
   227â†’**Updated Components:**
   228â†’- `HeroSection.tsx` - Receives `profile` prop
   229â†’- `AboutSection.tsx` - Receives `profile` prop
   230â†’- `CertificationsSection.tsx` - Receives `profile` prop
   231â†’
   232â†’**In Portfolio.tsx:**
   233â†’```tsx
   234â†’const { profile } = useVariant();  // Get from context
   235â†’
   236â†’<HeroSection profile={profile} isMobile={isMobile} ... />
   237â†’<AboutSection profile={profile} isMobile={isMobile} ... />
   238â†’```
   239â†’
   240â†’### Routing
   241â†’
   242â†’**HashRouter** (GitHub Pages compatible):
   243â†’```tsx
   244â†’// src/App.tsx
   245â†’<HashRouter>
   246â†’  <Routes>
   247â†’    <Route path="/" element={<BasePortfolio />} />
   248â†’    <Route path="/:company/:role" element={<VariantPortfolio />} />
   249â†’  </Routes>
   250â†’</HashRouter>
   251â†’```
   252â†’
   253â†’**Why Hash Routing?**
   254â†’- GitHub Pages doesn't support server-side redirects
   255â†’- Hash URLs (`/#/company/role`) handled client-side
   256â†’- Fully shareable and bookmarkable
   257â†’- Can switch to BrowserRouter on Vercel/Netlify with proper config
   258â†’
   259â†’### Build Process
   260â†’
   261â†’Variants are bundled as separate chunks for optimal loading:
   262â†’```
   263â†’dist/assets/
   264â†’â”œâ”€â”€ bloomberg-technical-product-manager-[hash].js  (4KB)
   265â†’â”œâ”€â”€ gensyn-technical-product-manager-[hash].js     (4KB)
   266â†’â””â”€â”€ index-[hash].js                                (main bundle)
   267â†’```
   268â†’
   269â†’Vite's `import.meta.glob` enables lazy loading:
   270â†’```typescript
   271â†’const variantFiles = import.meta.glob('../../content/variants/*.json', {
   272â†’  eager: false  // Lazy load only when needed
   273â†’});
   274â†’```
   275â†’
   276â†’---
   277â†’
   278â†’## Design System
   279â†’
   280â†’### CSS Variables (globals.css)
   281â†’
   282â†’| Category | Examples |
   283â†’|----------|----------|
   284â†’| **Colors** | `--color-background`, `--color-text-primary`, `--color-accent` |
   285â†’| **Spacing** | `--space-xs` (4px) through `--space-3xl` (64px) |
   286â†’| **Typography** | `--font-serif`, `--font-sans` |
   287â†’| **Transitions** | `--ease-smooth`, `--transition-medium` |
   288â†’
   289â†’### Theme Values
   290â†’
   291â†’| Token | Dark Mode | Light Mode |
   292â†’|-------|-----------|------------|
   293â†’| `--color-background` | #08080a | #fafafa |
   294â†’| `--color-text-primary` | #e8e6e3 | #050505 |
   295â†’| `--color-accent` | #c29a6c | #8a6642 |
   296â†’
   297â†’---

   319â†’
   320â†’## Recent Work (Dec 2024)
   321â†’
   322â†’### Design System Migration
   323â†’
   324â†’**Objective**: Migrate from React context-based colors to CSS custom properties
   325â†’
   326â†’**Changes Made:**
   327â†’1. Created `src/styles/globals.css` with all design tokens
   328â†’2. Updated `ThemeContext.tsx` to set `data-theme` attribute on `<html>`
   329â†’3. Migrated 8 components to use CSS variables instead of `useTheme().colors`:
   330â†’   - ThemeToggle.tsx
   331â†’   - FooterSection.tsx
   332â†’   - HeroSection.tsx
   333â†’   - AboutSection.tsx
   334â†’   - SocialSection.tsx

   341â†’- `1d5668e` - test: add design system test suite with Vitest
   342â†’
   343â†’---
   344â†’
   345â†’## Important Conventions
   346â†’
   347â†’### DO âœ…
   348â†’
   349â†’- Use CSS variables for all colors: `var(--color-*)`
   350â†’- Use spacing tokens: `var(--space-md)` not `16px`
   351â†’- Use font variables: `var(--font-serif)` not hardcoded strings
   352â†’- Run `npm run test:design-system` after design changes
   353â†’
   354â†’### DON'T âŒ
   355â†’
   356â†’- Import `colors` from `useTheme()` - this is deprecated
   357â†’- Use hardcoded hex colors in components
   358â†’- Use `isDark` conditionals for colors (CSS handles this now)
   359â†’

```
     1â†’# ğŸ¤– Agent Rules & Governance
     2â†’
     3â†’**ATTENTION ALL AI AGENTS:**
     4â†’This document serves as the **Supreme Law** for contributing to this codebase. You are required to read and adhere to these rules before making any changes.
     5â†’
     6â†’---
     7â†’
     8â†’## ğŸ“‹ 0. Developer Log (DEVLOG) â€” MANDATORY
     9â†’
    10â†’**Location:** `context/DEVLOG.md`
    11â†’
    12â†’### Rules:
    13â†’1. **Session Logging**: At the **end of every working session**, update `DEVLOG.md` with:
    14â†’   - Summary of work completed
    15â†’   - List of changes made (files, features, fixes)
    16â†’   - Issues encountered and their resolutions
    17â†’   - Tests added or modified
    18â†’   - Follow-up items for future sessions
    19â†’
    20â†’2. **Real-time Updates**: For significant changes during a session, log them as you go rather than waiting until the end.
    21â†’
    22â†’3. **Issue Tracking**: Every bug or unexpected behavior encountered MUST be logged with:
    23â†’   - Description of the issue
    24â†’   - Root cause (if identified)
    25â†’   - Resolution applied
    26â†’
    27â†’4. **Format**: Use the template provided in `DEVLOG.md` for consistency.
    28â†’
    29â†’---
    30â†’
    31â†’## ğŸš¨ 1. The "Design System First" Prime Directive
    32â†’
    33â†’**User Mandate:**
    34â†’> "If you make a change outside of the design system YOU HAVE TO make sure that it is clearly outlined, reasoned and the design system is updated. That way we keep things tidy and holistic from a design / UX perspective."
    35â†’
    36â†’### The Rules:
    37â†’1.  **Single Source of Truth**: The Design System (`context/DESIGN.md` and `src/styles/globals.css`) is the absolute authority on visual style.
    38â†’2.  **No "Snowflakes"**:
    39â†’    *   **NEVER** use hardcoded hex codes (e.g., `#FFFFFF`), pixels (e.g., `24px`), or ad-hoc styles in components.
    40â†’    *   **ALWAYS** use CSS variables defined in `globals.css` (e.g., `var(--color-text-primary)`, `var(--space-lg)`).
    41â†’3.  **Theme Parity**:
    42â†’    *   **Dark Mode != Light Mode**: Do not assume transparency or colors work the same.
    43â†’    *   **Verify Both**: Every visual change MUST be verified in both themes. If a feature exists in Dark Mode (e.g., ambient orbs), it MUST have a Light Mode equivalent.
    44â†’    If you need to introduce a new visual style, dimension, or pattern:
    45â†’    *   **Step 1: Reason**: Explicitly justify to the user *why* the existing system is insufficient.
    46â†’    *   **Step 2: Define**: Add the new token to `src/styles/globals.css`.
    47â†’    *   **Step 3: Document**: Update `context/DESIGN.md` to reflect the new addition.
    48â†’    *   **Step 4: Implement**: Only then, use the new token in your component.
    49â†’
    50â†’## 2. Codebase Maintenance & Anti-Hallucination
    51â†’*   **Documentation Alignment**: If you refactor code, you **MUST** update the corresponding section in `context/CODEBASE.md` or `context/DESIGN.md`.
    52â†’*   **Anti-Hallucination**: NEVER document a feature in `CODEBASE.md` or `ROADMAP.md` as "Implemented" or "Done" unless you have verified its existence in the current branch.
    53â†’*   **Data Integrity**: Always maintain Zod validation in `src/lib/content.ts` for any new content fields. Do not bypass type safety.
    54â†’
    55â†’## 3. The "No Direct Push" Law
    56â†’*   **Branch Protection**: The `main` branch is PROTECTED. Direct pushes are blocked.
    57â†’*   **Workflow**:
    58â†’    1. Create a descriptive feature branch (e.g., `feat/bundle-opt`).
    59â†’    2. Commit and push to the feature branch.
    60â†’    3. Open a Pull Request via `gh pr create`.
    61â†’    4. **MANDATORY**: PRs require 1 approval to merge.
    62â†’*   **Merge Style**: Use "Squash and Merge" for a clean `main` history.
    63â†’
    64â†’## 4. Documentation Governance
    65â†’*   **Mission Control Sync**: Any move, rename, or deletion of a `.md` file MUST be reflected in the root `README.md` map.
    66â†’*   **Deprecation Record**: If a planned feature is abandoned, move its description to a "Deprecated/Abandoned" section in `ROADMAP.md` with rationale, rather than silent deletion.
    67â†’
    68â†’## 3. Mandatory UI/UX Verification Checklist
    69â†’**MUST** be performed before finalizing any task involving UI/UX changes.
    70â†’
    71â†’- [ ] **Token First**: Did I check `globals.css` before writing any new style?
    72â†’- [ ] **No Magic Numbers**: Are all spacing/sizing values using `var(--space-*)` or `var(--layout-*)`? (Exception: 1-2px borders/offsets).
    73â†’- [ ] **Documentation Sync**: If I added a new variable, did I update `context/DESIGN.md`?
    74â†’- [ ] **Theme Check**: Did I verify the change works in both Dark AND Light mode? (Are ambient effects visible in both?)
    75â†’- [ ] **Mobile Check**: Did I verify responsive behavior (e.g., `isMobile` logic)?
    76â†’- [ ] **Honest Docs**: Did I ensure I am not "hallucinating" the completion of any feature in the docs?
    77â†’
    78â†’## 5. "The Prime Directive" of Design
    79â†’> "If it isn't in the Design System, it doesn't exist. If it needs to exist, update the Design System first."
    80â†’

```
     1â†’---
     2â†’name: run-tests
     3â†’description: Run the test suite and identify new tests needed for recent code changes. Use when verifying changes work correctly or when asked to run tests.
     4â†’---
     5â†’
     6â†’# Run Tests
     7â†’
     8â†’## Overview
     9â†’
    10â†’This skill runs the existing test suite and analyzes recent code changes to identify what new tests should be written to maintain coverage.
    11â†’
    12â†’## When to Use This Skill
    13â†’
    14â†’Activate when the user:
    15â†’- Says "run tests" or "/run-tests"
    16â†’- Asks to verify recent changes
    17â†’- Wants to know what tests are needed for new code
    18â†’- Asks about test coverage for recent updates
    19â†’
    20â†’## Execution Steps
    21â†’
    22â†’### Step 1: Run Existing Tests
    23â†’
    24â†’```bash
    25â†’npm run test
    26â†’```
    27â†’
    28â†’Report results:
    29â†’- Number of tests passed/failed
    30â†’- Any failing test details
    31â†’- Test duration
    32â†’
    33â†’### Step 2: Identify Recent Changes
    34â†’
    35â†’Check git status and recent commits:
    36â†’
    37â†’```bash
    38â†’git diff --name-only HEAD~5
    39â†’git diff --cached --name-only
    40â†’git status --porcelain
    41â†’```
    42â†’
    43â†’Focus on:
    44â†’- Modified `.tsx` and `.ts` files in `src/`
    45â†’- New components or features
    46â†’- Changes to existing components
    47â†’
    48â†’### Step 3: Analyze Test Coverage Gaps
    49â†’
    50â†’For each changed file, determine if tests exist:
    51â†’
    52â†’| Source File | Test File Location |
    53â†’|-------------|-------------------|
    54â†’| `src/components/sections/*.tsx` | `src/tests/design-system/components.test.tsx` |
    55â†’| `src/components/case-study/*.tsx` | `src/tests/case-study/case-study.test.tsx` |
    56â†’| `src/components/Blog.tsx` | `src/tests/blog/blog-ux-features.test.tsx` |
    57â†’| `src/lib/*.ts` | `src/tests/validation/content-validation.test.ts` |
    58â†’| Navigation changes | `src/tests/navigation/navigation.test.tsx` |
    59â†’| Mobile-specific | `src/tests/mobile/mobile.test.tsx` |
    60â†’| Theme/CSS changes | `src/tests/design-system/css-variables.test.ts` |
    61â†’
    62â†’### Step 4: Recommend New Tests
    63â†’
    64â†’For each uncovered change, suggest specific tests following the project patterns:
    65â†’
    66â†’**Test Pattern Template:**
    67â†’```tsx
    68â†’import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';
    69â†’import { ThemeProvider } from '../../context/ThemeContext';
    70â†’import { VariantProvider } from '../../context/VariantContext';
    71â†’import { profile } from '../../lib/content';
    72â†’
    73â†’const TestWrapper = ({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    74â†’    <VariantProvider profile={profile}>
    75â†’        <ThemeProvider>{children}</ThemeProvider>
    76â†’    </VariantProvider>
    77â†’);
    78â†’
    79â†’describe('[ComponentName]', () => {
    80â†’    it('should [expected behavior]', () => {
    81â†’        render(
    82â†’            <TestWrapper>
    83â†’                <ComponentName {...props} />
    84â†’            </TestWrapper>
    85â†’        );
    86â†’
    87â†’        expect(/* assertion */).toBe(/* expected */);
    88â†’    });
    89â†’});
    90â†’```
    91â†’
    92â†’## Output Format
    93â†’
    94â†’```
    95â†’## Test Results
    96â†’
    97â†’**Status**: âœ… All passing | âŒ X failures
    98â†’**Tests**: X passed, X failed, X total
    99â†’**Duration**: Xs
   100â†’
   101â†’### Failures (if any)

   105â†’

   112â†’---
   113â†’
   114â†’## Recommended New Tests
   115â†’
   116â†’### 1. [Test Name]
   117â†’**File**: `src/tests/[path]/[file].test.tsx`
   118â†’**Covers**: [what it tests]
   119â†’
   120â†’```tsx
   121â†’[test code suggestion]
   122â†’```
   123â†’
   124â†’### 2. ...
   125â†’```
   126â†’
   127â†’## Test Categories
   128â†’
   129â†’### Component Tests
   130â†’- Render without crashing
   131â†’- Uses CSS variables (not hardcoded colors)
   132â†’- Correct props handling
   133â†’- User interactions (clicks, hovers)
   134â†’- Accessibility attributes
   135â†’
   136â†’### Integration Tests
   137â†’- Data flows correctly from content files
   138â†’- Links render with correct URLs
   139â†’- Conditional rendering works
   140â†’
   141â†’### Responsive Tests
   142â†’- Mobile layout differences
   143â†’- Tablet breakpoints
   144â†’- Desktop behavior
   145â†’
   146â†’## Common Test Assertions
   147â†’
   148â†’```tsx
   149â†’// Element exists
   150â†’expect(screen.getByText('text')).toBeInTheDocument();
   151â†’
   152â†’// Has attribute
   153â†’expect(element).toHaveAttribute('href', 'url');
   154â†’
   155â†’// CSS variable usage
   156â†’expect(element?.style.color).toContain('var(--color-');
   157â†’
   158â†’// Link behavior
   159â†’expect(link).toHaveAttribute('target', '_blank');
   160â†’expect(link).toHaveAttribute('rel', 'noopener noreferrer');
   161â†’```
   162â†’
   163â†’## File Locations
   164â†’
   165â†’| Purpose | Path |
   166â†’|---------|------|
   167â†’| Run tests | `npm run test` |
   168â†’| Watch mode | `npm run test:watch` |
   169â†’| Design system only | `npm run test:design-system` |
   170â†’| Test config | `vitest.config.ts` (if exists) or `vite.config.ts` |
   171â†’| Test setup | `src/tests/setup.ts` (if exists) |
   172â†’

<summary>Tool use: **Write**</summary>


```md
---
name: sprint-sync
description: Multi-perspective project onboarding and sprint briefing. Simulates a team of Lead PM, Designer, Architect, and Engineer ramping up on project status. Use at session start or when context is needed.
---

# Sprint Sync

## Overview

This skill provides comprehensive project context from four leadership perspectives, simulating how a cross-functional team would onboard to the current state of the project. Briefings are persisted to `context/BRIEFINGS.md` for historical reference.

## When to Use This Skill

Activate when the user:
- Says "sprint sync", "/sprint-sync", or "sync me up"
- Starts a new session and needs context
- Asks "where are we?" or "what's the status?"
- Wants to understand current priorities
- Says "onboard me" or "catch me up"

## Invocation Modes

| Command | Mode | Duration |
|---------|------|----------|
| `/sprint-sync` | Quick sync | ~30 sec |
| `/sprint-sync --hardcore` | Full deep dive (all sections) | ~2-3 min |
| `/sprint-sync --deep pm` | PM perspective deep dive | ~1 min |
| `/sprint-sync --deep design` | Designer perspective deep dive | ~1 min |
| `/sprint-sync --deep arch` | Architect perspective deep dive | ~1 min |
| `/sprint-sync --deep eng` | Engineer perspective deep dive | ~1 min |

## Execution Steps

### Phase 0: Setup

1. Note current timestamp for briefing header
2. Determine mode from args (quick/hardcore/specific deep dive)

### Phase 1: Quick Sync (Default Mode)

Read these files and extract key information:

| File | Extract |
|------|---------|
| `context/DEVLOG.md` | "Active Project Pulse" section (lines near top) |
| `context/ROADMAP.md` | Phase status, checkmarks, current priorities |
| `git log --oneline -10` | Recent commits |
| `npm run test 2>&1 \| head -20` | Test status summary |

Generate **Quick Briefing** output (see Output Formats below).

### Phase 2: Deep Dive Mode (--hardcore or --deep [section])

#### PM Deep Dive (`--deep pm` or `--hardcore`)

**Additional Reads:**
- Full `context/ROADMAP.md` analysis
- `context/DEVLOG.md` - last 3 session summaries
- `git log --oneline -20` - extended history
- Check for any TODO comments in recent commits

**Generate:**
- Milestone completion percentages
- Dependency mapping between tasks
- Risk assessment (blockers, technical debt)
- ASCII roadmap progress bar

**ASCII Diagram - Roadmap Status:**
\```
â”Œâ”€ ROADMAP STATUS â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

\```

#### Designer Deep Dive (`--deep design` or `--hardcore`)

**Additional Reads:**
- `context/DESIGN.md` - full design system
- `src/styles/globals.css` - CSS variable inventory
- Recent commits touching `*.css` or style-related files
- `context/AGENT_RULES.md` - design governance rules

**Generate:**
- Design token inventory count
- Recent UI/UX changes summary
- Theme parity status (dark/light)
- Component style compliance check

**ASCII Diagram - Design System:**
\```
â”Œâ”€ DESIGN SYSTEM HEALTH â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

#### Architect Deep Dive (`--deep arch` or `--hardcore`)

**Additional Reads:**
- `context/CODEBASE.md` - full architecture docs
- `src/lib/schemas.ts` - Zod schema definitions
- `package.json` - dependency overview
- `vite.config.ts` - build configuration
- Test file inventory

**Generate:**
- Architecture component map
- Data flow diagram
- Dependency graph (key packages)
- Test coverage summary
- Bundle size concerns

#### Engineer Deep Dive (`--deep eng` or `--hardcore`)

**Additional Reads:**
- `git log --oneline -20` with file stats
- `git diff --stat HEAD~10` - change volume
- Recent PR merges
- Test results with timing
- Any failing tests or build issues

**Generate:**
- Commit frequency analysis
- Hot files (most changed recently)
- What's working vs. what needs attention
- Immediate action items

**ASCII Diagram - Recent Activity:**
\```

### Phase 3: Save Briefing

**CRITICAL**: All briefings MUST be appended to `context/BRIEFINGS.md`

1. Read existing `context/BRIEFINGS.md` (create if doesn't exist)
2. Append new briefing with clear delimiter
3. Include timestamp, mode, and all generated content
4. Include ASCII diagrams

**Briefing Delimiter Format:**
\```markdown
---

## Sprint Briefing â€” [YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM]
**Mode**: [Quick | Hardcore | Deep Dive: PM/Design/Arch/Eng]
**Generated by**: sprint-sync skill

[briefing content with ASCII diagrams]

---
\```

## Output Formats

### Quick Briefing (Default)

\```markdown
## Sprint Briefing â€” [Date Time]

### Project Pulse (PM View)
- **Current Phase**: [Phase X - Name]
- **Last Action**: [from DEVLOG Active Pulse]
- **Next Priority**: [from ROADMAP/DEVLOG]
- **Blockers**: [identified issues or "None"]

### Design Status (Designer View)
- **Design System**: [Compliant / X violations found]
- **Recent UI Changes**: [from git log]
- **Theme Parity**: [Verified / Needs attention]

### Architecture Health (Architect View)
- **Test Coverage**: [X tests passing]
- **Technical Debt**: [key items from ROADMAP]
- **Key Patterns**: CSS variables, Zod validation, HashRouter

### Recent Work (Engineer View)
- **Last 5 Commits**:
  - [commit 1]
  - [commit 2]
  - ...
- **What's Working**: [recent completions]
- **Needs Attention**: [blockers/issues]

### Recommended First Actions
1. [Most important next step]
2. [Second priority]
3. [Third priority]
\```

### Hardcore Briefing

Includes all four ASCII diagrams plus:
- Extended analysis for each section
- Cross-references between sections
- Dependency mapping
- Full action item list with priorities

## File Locations

| Purpose | Path |
|---------|------|
| Briefing history | `context/BRIEFINGS.md` |
| Project pulse | `context/DEVLOG.md` (Active Project Pulse section) |
| Roadmap | `context/ROADMAP.md` |
| Codebase docs | `context/CODEBASE.md` |
| Design system | `context/DESIGN.md` |
| Agent rules | `context/AGENT_RULES.md` |
| CSS tokens | `src/styles/globals.css` |
| Schemas | `src/lib/schemas.ts` |

## Example Session Start

\```
User: /sprint-sync

Claude: [Reads DEVLOG, ROADMAP, runs git log and tests]

## Sprint Briefing â€” 2025-12-20 14:30

### Project Pulse (PM View)
- **Current Phase**: Phase 3 - Social & Content (60% complete)
- **Last Action**: Blog UX sprint completed with 44 tests
- **Next Priority**: Bundle size reduction (467KB â†’ <200KB)
- **Blockers**: Performance (467KB bundle blocking LCP)

### Design Status (Designer View)
- **Design System**: Compliant (all tokens in globals.css)
- **Recent UI Changes**: LinkedIn share button, blog reading features
- **Theme Parity**: Verified (dark/light both working)

...

[Briefing saved to context/BRIEFINGS.md]
\```

## Notes

- Always run tests as part of sync to catch regressions early
- The "Active Project Pulse" section in DEVLOG.md is the single source of truth for current status
- If BRIEFINGS.md doesn't exist, create it with a header
- Never truncate or summarize ASCII diagrams - they provide quick visual context
- Hardcore mode should take 2-3 minutes max; optimize reads

# State of the Union: Portfolio Command Center
**Version**: 3.0
**Date**: 2025-12-20
**Branch**: `main`

---

## Executive Summary

The portfolio is **production-ready at 80%** with solid technical foundations. The YAML-to-Zod pipeline is robust, the Blog UX sprint delivered exceptional value, and 187 tests pass. However, **bundle size (467KB)** is a critical performance blocker, and the **Testimonials section** doesn't convey Director-level seniority.

**The "Hired-on-Sight" Delta**: Performance optimization + social proof enhancement.

## Part VI: Agent Governance

> **ATTENTION ALL AI AGENTS**: This section serves as the **Supreme Law** for contributing to this codebase.

### 6.1 Developer Log (DEVLOG) â€” MANDATORY

**Location**: `context/DEVLOG.md`

| Rule | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Session Logging | At **end of every session**, update DEVLOG with: summary, changes, issues, tests, follow-ups |
| Real-time Updates | Log significant changes as you go |
| Issue Tracking | Every bug must include: description, root cause, resolution |
| Format | Use the template in DEVLOG.md |

### 6.2 The "Design System First" Prime Directive

> "If it isn't in the Design System, it doesn't exist. If it needs to exist, update the Design System first."

**Rules**:
1. **Single Source of Truth**: `context/DESIGN.md` and `src/styles/globals.css` are the authority
2. **No Snowflakes**: NEVER use hardcoded hex codes or pixels. ALWAYS use CSS variables
3. **Theme Parity**: Every change MUST work in both Dark AND Light mode

**Adding New Tokens**:
1. **Reason**: Justify why existing system is insufficient
2. **Define**: Add token to `src/styles/globals.css`
3. **Document**: Update `context/DESIGN.md`
4. **Implement**: Only then use in component

### 6.3 Codebase Maintenance

| Rule | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Documentation Alignment | Refactoring code? Update CODEBASE.md or DESIGN.md |
| Anti-Hallucination | NEVER document a feature as "Done" unless verified in current branch |
| Data Integrity | Maintain Zod validation for all content fields |

### 6.4 Git Workflow

| Rule | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Branch Protection | `main` is PROTECTED â€” no direct pushes |
| Feature Branches | Create descriptive branches (e.g., `feat/bundle-opt`) |
| Pull Requests | Use `gh pr create`, require 1 approval |
| Merge Style | Squash and Merge for clean history |

### 6.5 UI/UX Verification Checklist

Before finalizing any UI/UX task:

- [ ] **Token First**: Checked `globals.css` before writing styles?
- [ ] **No Magic Numbers**: Using `var(--space-*)` or `var(--layout-*)`?
- [ ] **Documentation Sync**: Updated `DESIGN.md` for new variables?
- [ ] **Theme Check**: Verified in both Dark AND Light mode?
- [ ] **Mobile Check**: Verified responsive behavior?
- [ ] **Honest Docs**: Not hallucinating feature completion?

### 6.6 Documentation Governance

| Rule | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Mission Control Sync | File moves/renames must update README.md |
| Deprecation Record | Abandoned features go to "Deprecated" section with rationale |

   177â†’## Part VI: Agent Governance
   178â†’
   179â†’> **ATTENTION ALL AI AGENTS**: This section serves as the **Supreme Law** for contributing to this codebase.
   180â†’
   181â†’### 6.1 Developer Log (DEVLOG) â€” MANDATORY
   182â†’
   183â†’**Location**: `context/DEVLOG.md`
   184â†’
   185â†’| Rule | Description |
   186â†’|------|-------------|
   187â†’| Session Logging | At **end of every session**, update DEVLOG with: summary, changes, issues, tests, follow-ups |
   188â†’| Real-time Updates | Log significant changes as you go |
   189â†’| Issue Tracking | Every bug must include: description, root cause, resolution |
   190â†’| Format | Use the template in DEVLOG.md |
   191â†’
   192â†’### 6.2 The "Design System First" Prime Directive
   193â†’
   194â†’> "If it isn't in the Design System, it doesn't exist. If it needs to exist, update the Design System first."
   195â†’
   196â†’**Rules**:
   197â†’1. **Single Source of Truth**: `context/DESIGN.md` and `src/styles/globals.css` are the authority
   198â†’2. **No Snowflakes**: NEVER use hardcoded hex codes or pixels. ALWAYS use CSS variables
   199â†’3. **Theme Parity**: Every change MUST work in both Dark AND Light mode
   200â†’
   201â†’**Adding New Tokens**:
   202â†’1. **Reason**: Justify why existing system is insufficient
   203â†’2. **Define**: Add token to `src/styles/globals.css`
   204â†’3. **Document**: Update `context/DESIGN.md`
   205â†’4. **Implement**: Only then use in component
   206â†’
   207â†’### 6.3 Codebase Maintenance
   208â†’
   209â†’| Rule | Description |
   210â†’|------|-------------|
   211â†’| Documentation Alignment | Refactoring code? Update CODEBASE.md or DESIGN.md |
   212â†’| Anti-Hallucination | NEVER document a feature as "Done" unless verified in current branch |
   213â†’| Data Integrity | Maintain Zod validation for all content fields |
   214â†’
   215â†’### 6.4 Git Workflow
   216â†’
   217â†’| Rule | Description |
   218â†’|------|-------------|
   219â†’| Branch Protection | `main` is PROTECTED â€” no direct pushes |
   220â†’| Feature Branches | Create descriptive branches (e.g., `feat/bundle-opt`) |
   221â†’| Pull Requests | Use `gh pr create`, require 1 approval |
   222â†’| Merge Style | Squash and Merge for clean history |
   223â†’
   224â†’### 6.5 UI/UX Verification Checklist
   225â†’
   226â†’Before finalizing any UI/UX task:
   227â†’
   228â†’- [ ] **Token First**: Checked `globals.css` before writing styles?
   229â†’- [ ] **No Magic Numbers**: Using `var(--space-*)` or `var(--layout-*)`?
   230â†’- [ ] **Documentation Sync**: Updated `DESIGN.md` for new variables?
   231â†’- [ ] **Theme Check**: Verified in both Dark AND Light mode?
   232â†’- [ ] **Mobile Check**: Verified responsive behavior?
   233â†’- [ ] **Honest Docs**: Not hallucinating feature completion?
   234â†’
   235â†’### 6.6 Documentation Governance
   236â†’
   237â†’| Rule | Description |
   238â†’|------|-------------|
   239â†’| Mission Control Sync | File moves/renames must update README.md |
   240â†’| Deprecation Record | Abandoned features go to "Deprecated" section with rationale |

<summary>Tool use: **Write**</summary>


```md
---
name: sprint-sync
description: Multi-perspective project onboarding and sprint briefing. Simulates a cross-functional leadership team (PM, Designer, Architect, Engineer) ramping up on project status. Appends briefings to STATE_OF_THE_UNION.md Part VIII.
---

# Sprint Sync

## Overview

This skill provides comprehensive project context from four leadership perspectives, simulating how a cross-functional team would onboard to the current state of the project. All briefings are appended to `context/STATE_OF_THE_UNION.md` Part VIII for historical reference.

## When to Use This Skill

Activate when the user:
- Says "sprint sync", "/sprint-sync", or "sync me up"
- Starts a new session and needs context
- Asks "where are we?" or "what's the status?"
- Wants to understand current priorities
- Says "onboard me" or "catch me up"

## Invocation Modes

| Command | Mode | Duration | Output |
|---------|------|----------|--------|
| `/sprint-sync` | Quick | ~30 sec | Summary briefing |
| `/sprint-sync --hardcore` | Full deep dive | ~2-3 min | All ASCII diagrams + full analysis |
| `/sprint-sync --deep pm` | PM deep dive | ~1 min | Roadmap + priorities + blockers |
| `/sprint-sync --deep design` | Designer deep dive | ~1 min | Design system + theme audit |
| `/sprint-sync --deep arch` | Architect deep dive | ~1 min | Architecture + dependencies |
| `/sprint-sync --deep eng` | Engineer deep dive | ~1 min | Recent changes + hot files |

## Execution Steps

### Phase 0: Gather Context

**Always read these files first:**

| File | Extract |
|------|---------|
| `context/STATE_OF_THE_UNION.md` | Parts I-V for strategic context, Part VII for roadmap |
| `context/DEVLOG.md` | "Active Project Pulse" + last 2 session summaries |

**Always run these commands:**

\```bash
git log --oneline -10                    # Recent commits
npm run test 2>&1 | tail -20             # Test status
\```

---

### Phase 1: Quick Sync (Default Mode)

Generate a concise briefing covering all four perspectives in summary form.

**Output Structure:**
\```
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
SPRINT BRIEFING â€” [YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM]
Mode: Quick
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Project Pulse (PM View)
- **Current Phase**: [from SOTU Part VII]
- **Last Action**: [from DEVLOG Active Pulse]
- **Next Priority**: [from SOTU Part IV P0]
- **Blockers**: [from SOTU Technical Debt]

## Design Status (Designer View)
- **Design System**: [Compliant / issues found]
- **Recent UI Changes**: [from git log]
- **Theme Parity**: [from SOTU 1.3]

## Architecture Health (Architect View)
- **Test Status**: [from npm test output]
- **Bundle Size**: [from SOTU]
- **Tech Debt**: [top 2-3 items from SOTU]

## Recent Work (Engineer View)
- **Last 5 Commits**: [from git log]
- **What's Working**: [recent completions]
- **Needs Attention**: [blockers/P0 items]

## Recommended Actions
1. [First priority from P0]
2. [Second priority]
3. [Third priority]

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
\```

---

### Phase 2: Deep Dive Modes

#### PM Deep Dive (`--deep pm` or `--hardcore`)

**Additional Context:**
- Full SOTU Part VII (Strategic Roadmap)
- SOTU Part IV (Priority Action Plan)
- Last 3 DEVLOG sessions
- `git log --oneline -20`

**Generate ASCII Diagram:**
\```

### Phase 3: Save Briefing

**CRITICAL**: All briefings MUST be appended to `context/STATE_OF_THE_UNION.md` Part VIII.

**Process:**
1. Read current STATE_OF_THE_UNION.md
2. Find Part VIII: Sprint Briefings section
3. Locate the line `*No briefings yet.*` or end of last briefing
4. Append new briefing with delimiter format
5. Write updated file

**Delimiter Format:**
\```markdown

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
SPRINT BRIEFING â€” YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM
Mode: [Quick | Hardcore | Deep: PM/Design/Arch/Eng]
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

[Full briefing content including ASCII diagrams]

---

## Hardcore Mode (`--hardcore`)

When `--hardcore` flag is present:

1. Run ALL four deep dives (PM, Design, Arch, Eng)
2. Generate ALL four ASCII diagrams
3. Cross-reference findings between perspectives
4. Generate comprehensive action plan with priorities
5. Include risk assessment matrix

**Additional ASCII Diagram for Hardcore Mode:**

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="Write"><details>
<summary>Tool use: **Write**</summary>


```javascript
#!/usr/bin/env node
/**
 * Generate OG images from HTML templates
 *
 * Usage:
 *   npm run generate:og          # Generate both dark and light
 *   npm run generate:og -- dark  # Generate dark only
 *   npm run generate:og -- light # Generate light only
 *
 * Output:
 *   public/images/og-image.png       (dark - default for social)
 *   public/images/og-image-light.png (light - alternative)
 */

import puppeteer from 'puppeteer';
import { fileURLToPath } from 'url';
import { dirname, resolve } from 'path';

const __filename = fileURLToPath(import.meta.url);
const __dirname = dirname(__filename);
const rootDir = resolve(__dirname, '..');

const templates = {
  dark: {
    input: resolve(rootDir, 'public/og-image-dark.html'),
    output: resolve(rootDir, 'public/images/og-image.png'),
  },
  light: {
    input: resolve(rootDir, 'public/og-image-light.html'),
    output: resolve(rootDir, 'public/images/og-image-light.png'),
  },
};

async function generateImage(variant) {
  const config = templates[variant];
  if (!config) {
    console.error(`Unknown variant: ${variant}`);
    process.exit(1);
  }

  console.log(`Generating ${variant} OG image...`);

  const browser = await puppeteer.launch({
    headless: true,
    args: ['--no-sandbox', '--disable-setuid-sandbox'],
  });

  const page = await browser.newPage();

  // Set viewport to exact OG image dimensions
  await page.setViewport({
    width: 1200,
    height: 630,
    deviceScaleFactor: 2, // 2x for retina quality
  });

  // Load the HTML template
  await page.goto(`file://${config.input}`, {
    waitUntil: 'networkidle0', // Wait for fonts to load
  });

  // Wait a bit more for fonts to fully render
  await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 1000));

  // Take screenshot
  await page.screenshot({
    path: config.output,
    type: 'png',
    clip: {
      x: 0,
      y: 0,
      width: 1200,
      height: 630,
    },
  });

  await browser.close();

  console.log(`  âœ“ Saved: ${config.output}`);
}

async function main() {
  const args = process.argv.slice(2);

  if (args.length === 0) {
    // Generate both
    await generateImage('dark');
    await generateImage('light');
  } else {
    // Generate specified variant
    for (const variant of args) {
      await generateImage(variant);
    }
  }

  console.log('\nDone! OG images generated.');
  console.log('\nTo test social previews:');
  console.log('  - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/post-inspector/');
  console.log('  - Twitter: https://cards-dev.twitter.com/validator');
  console.log('  - Facebook: https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/');
  console.log('  - General: https://www.opengraph.xyz/');
}

main().catch(console.error);

```
```
File created successfully at: /Users/dfotesco/.claude-worktrees/portfolio/eloquent-hermann/scripts/generate-og-images.js
```
